results.title: Scott no friends
results.brief_description:
This responsive display presents the moment, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

PM Scott Morrison got the cold shoulder at the G20 conference in Rome. His 11th-hour plan for net-zero emissions by 2050 was criticised at home and abroad for lacking any real details, except faith that uninvented tech might save the day, and the French president labelled him a liar over the submarine fiasco. Other world leaders made their displeasure to the government’s handling of recent issues known by collectively shunning the maskless Morrison during a group photo.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Prime Minister Scott Morrison got the cold shoulder at the G20 conference in Rome. Not only did the French president label him a liar over the submarine fiasco, his 11th-hour plan for net-zero emissions by 2050 was criticised around the world (and at home) for lacking any new funding, policies or details – except faith that yet-to-be-invented tech might save the day. Other world leaders made their displeasure known by collectively shunning the maskless Morrison during a group photo opportunity.

While the original footage in this video was broadcast on 7 News, Labor MP Patrick Gorman (and likely his social media team) added the theme music to TV show Curb Your Enthusiasm, equating the Australian Prime Minister with the fictional version of Larry David, whose ignorance and disregard for social conventions results in awkward, cringe-worthy moments on the show. The addition of end cards further establishes the sitcom style, featuring the names of other coalition members, suggesting that the government’s climate policy is a joke that’s resulted in this bumbling Larry David-like instance of international embarrassment.

Other world leaders made their displeasure known by collectively shunning the maskless Morrison during a group photo opportunity.

results.title: Lockdown finally coming to an end
results.brief_description: After winning the unenvious title of most lock-down city in the world, Melbournians could certainly relate to Willy the Whale’s fantastic feeling of freedom in the pivotal scene of early 90’s classic, Free Willy. Originally posted in 2020 at the end of Victoria’s mammoth 112-day lockdown number two, the clip, feels all the more relevant in 2021 after a total of 263 days spent across six periods of lockdown captivity.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

After living in one of the world’s most locked-down cities, Melburnians could certainly relate to Willy the whale’s feeling of freedom in the climax of early 90s classic, Free Willy. Originally posted in 2020 at the end of Victoria’s mammoth 112-day second lockdown, the clip feels all the more relevant in 2021 after a total of 262 days spent across six periods of stay-at-home orders.

results.title: Jeff Bezos post-launch brief
results.brief_description:
Following Jeff Bezos’ launch into space on the New Shephard rocket ship, the billionaire took a moment to thank those who had made it possible. The ten-minute, $5.5 billion trip was essentially bankrolled by Amazon customers and employees – the latter of whom are renowned for being criminally overworked and underpaid. During a period of historic inequality, a billionaire blasting off a planet ravaged by the climate crisis and a pandemic seemed tone-deaf at best, villainous at worst.

It also wasn’t lost on many social media users how phallic the New Shephard’s shape seemed to be, generating an avalanche of quips suggesting Bezos was overcompensating for… something. Naturally, the internet didn’t take long to compare the New Shephard to the rocket launched by Dr Evil in Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me. While these jokes may seem throw-away moments of internet culture, they, like others referencing his recent divorce, use humour and absurdity to bring Bezos back down to earth. And the backlash isn’t only against the Amazon founder, but also Richard Branson and Elon Musk, billionaires jostling to beat each other into the stratosphere in a space race that exposes how massive corporations and individuals now possess the resources to do what was once reserved for Cold War superpowers. While Bezos timed the launch on the anniversary of the 1969 Moon landing, many Twitter users noted the disparity between that globally unifying moment and the disillusionment of watching a man who could end poverty take an intergalactic joyride.

results.title: America's Cup Challenge for Amstrad
results.creator_credit: Armchair Entertainment, US Gold Pty Ltd and Micro Forte Studios
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover and manual in a plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description:
America’s Cup Challenge is a one to two player competitive sports simulation. The included manual contains a lot of information about the America’s Cup including yachting terminology, race legs, wind angles, sails and weather conditions. The player controls the crew of a racing yacht using the joystick, chosing the type of sail at the start of the race and then switching between three different modes, helmsman, sails selection and winching. As Helmsman, players control the yacht’s direction. Sail selection allows players to move the angle of the sail’s boom and the level of use of the spinnaker or genoa. The manual advises the use of a good quality robust joystick.

Source: Play It Again website: http://www.ourdigitalheritage.org/archive/playitagain/games/arnies-americas-cup-challenge/
Last accessed: 14/04/2021

Original game developed by Micro Forté Pty. Ltd. for Commodore 64, published by Electronic Arts (USA) and U.S. Gold (Europe) in 1986.

results.creator_credit: House and Moorhouse Films, Film Victoria, Peter Szabo and Associates, Lynda House, Jocelyn Moorhouse and P.J. Hogan
results.brief_description: Muriel is a dag, an Abba maniac and an out of place girl who would give anything to be like her nasty friends. In her hunt to find Mr. Right in all the wrong places, Muriel takes a one-way ticket to freedom to find herself.

constellations_other.name: Jill Bilcock
constellations_other.description: An editor’s work often goes unnoticed, but they’re scene-stitching not only brings the director’s vision to life but sometimes steals the show. One of Australia’s greatest editors, Jill Bilcock, has shaped some of the country’s most memorable screen stories.

results.creator_credit_for_label: House and Moorhouse Films, Film Victoria, Peter Szabo and Associates, Lynda House, Jocelyn Moorhouse and P.J. Hogan
results.description:
Muriel is a dag, an Abba maniac and an out-of-place girl who would give anything to be like her nasty friends. In her hunt to find Mr. Right in all the wrong places, Muriel takes a one-way ticket to freedom to find herself. A bittersweet and much acclaimed film that touches on themes of self-respect, identity and friendship.

Toni Collette gives an inspired performance as Muriel and the supporting cast includes Bill Hunter, Sophie Lee, Jeanie Drynan and Rachel Griffiths.

results.title: The House of the Dead [computer game]
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM and manual in Sega Saturn case
results.brief_description:
The House of the Dead is console port of the popular arcade shooter. The player, as agent Thomas Rogan or his partner “G” must rescue Rogan’s fiancée Sophie Richards from the evil scientist Dr. Curien and his undead creations.

This release inherits the same a rail shooter mechanic, where the player is guided through a haunted mansion filled with the undead. The player must shoot any enemies before being attacked while also not shooting any hostages. Items that grant health or different upgrades can also be found. The game also has several points where the player can actively affect the course of the game through their actions. For instance, if a player saves a hostage who is about to be thrown from a bridge, that hostage can open a different route through the game.

This port also contains two extra modes called Saturn Mode and Boss Mode. Saturn mode plays like the arcade game, but offers the player different characters to choose from who have varying attributes like reload time and amount of health. The Boss Mode allows the player to fight one boss of their choosing or all of the game’s four boss monsters consecutively.

results.title: Halloween Harry [computer game]
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM and CD envelope in cardboard box
results.brief_description:
Halloween Harry is set in the 21st century, and features Harry, a ghost hunter, facing off against all sorts of evil across 13 levels. Essentially, it is a platform shooter with some puzzle-solving elements, set on a single screen.

The game instructions, which appear on the start screen, state: ‘It is the 21st century and from this futuristic new world comes an exciting new hero: HALLOWEEN HARRY! As Halloween Harry, a fearless ghost-hunter, you have been assigned to destroy an evil witch who has taken over a 13-room building. You do this by collecting the magic item in each room, then escape through a mystical door. There are 12 items to collect, ranging from a broom in room 1 to a cauldron in room 12. When all the items are collected, you must confront the witch in the 13th room. The witch is protected by a magical barrier, so you must collect a padlock and a key (in any order) so that her defence is broken down… Once exposed, you may zap the witch with your trusty garlic-blaster laser gun, (which has 13 shots). 3 additional shots may be obtained by grabbing the bonus garlic. To make your task difficult, the witch has summoned up various ghosts and ghouls, as well as the dreaded dropjaws and zombie hands to destroy you! Don’t forget there’s a time limit. It can be extended by the magic hourglass that appears when time is low.’

Source: Play It Again website:
http://www.ourdigitalheritage.org/archive/playitagain/games/halloween-harry/

Last accessed: 11/05/2021

Original game developed by John Passfield. Published in 1985 by HoneySoft.

results.title: [Phillip Annett Home Movie]
results.brief_description:
This home movie was originally created on 16mm film by Phillip Annett. It was donated to ACMI by Daryl Annett.

This film is a snap shot of suburban life in Melbourne. There are wonderful examples of fashion, inner-Melbourne street scenes, architecture and cars of the time. We see a children’s birthday party and backyard games under the Hills Hoist as well as neighbours chatting over the fence to passers-by in the street. Men in Australian Army and Air Force uniforms pose and smile for the camera, and there are scenes of a road trip to regional Victoria. We see a fire truck display, horse and harness riding as well as woodchopping displays at the Royal Melbourne Show. There are candid images of a horse event competitor in the stables area of the Royal Melbourne Show, as well as St Kilda Road buses and trams as they travel down the road. Black and white images of a horse and cart and a man in a bowler hat performing tricks is a fantastic moment in time.
